com.xith3d.render
Interface RenderPeer

All Known Implementing Classes:
RenderPeerBase
public interface RenderPeer

The render peer is used to abstract the layer that does the actual drawing from the architecture of the renderer.

Copyright (c) 2003 David Yazel Copyright (c) 2003

Company:

Version:
1.0
Author:
David Yazel

Method Detail

makeCanvas

public CanvasPeer makeCanvas(Object owner,
                             int width,
                             int height,
                             int bits,
                             boolean fullScreen)
Parameters:
owner - Optional owner window. This is to support JOGL and Java3D which use a component model.
width - The width of the window
height - The height of the window
bits - The number of bits of resolution 16 or 32
fullScreen - Should this be rendered in full screen
Returns:

registerShader

public void registerShader(String shaderClassName,
                           ShaderPeer shaderPeer)
Registers an API specific rendering peer. An appearance shader could be implemented differently in LWJGL and JOGL.

Parameters:
shaderClassName -
shaderPeer -

registerAtomRenderer

public void registerAtomRenderer(String atomClassName,
                                 RenderAtomPeer atomPeer)
The render atom peer implements the API specific commands necessry to render the geometry. For example a GeometryArray

Parameters:
atomClassName -
atomPeer -

getShaderPeer

public ShaderPeer getShaderPeer(Shader shader)
Gets the shader peer for this shader. The first time we hit a stateType we have not seen yet this will need to lookup the class and assign it to the state type. Subsequent times it is a quick lookup.

Parameters:
shader -
Returns:

getRenderAtomPeer

public RenderAtomPeer getRenderAtomPeer(RenderAtom atom)
Gets the render atom peer for this atom. The first time we hit a stateType we have not seen yet this will need to lookup the class and assign it to the state type. Subsequent times it is a quick lookup.

Returns:
